etymology.description: 彡(彡) (shān, "representing patterns or ornamentation") + 周(周) (zhōu, "encircle") = carving patterns -> carve
etymology.interpretation: The character 彫(diāo, "to carve") combines 彡(shān, "patterns") as the semantic element to imply ornamentation, with 周(zhōu, "encircle") as a phonetic component indicating sound. Together, they symbolize the act of engraving or carving patterns.

examples.chinese: 他仔细彫(彫)出木头上的花纹(花紋)，展现了纯熟的技艺(技藝)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǐxì diāo chū mùtou shàng de huāwén, zhǎnxiàn le chúnshú de jìyì.
examples.english: He carefully carved patterns on the wood, showcasing his refined craftsmanship.

examples.chinese: 古代名匠彫(彫)出精致的石像(石像)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài míngjiàng diāo chū jīngzhì de shíxiàng.
examples.english: Ancient master craftsmen carved exquisite stone statues.
